definition: Mt Song in Henan, central mountain of the Five Sacred Mountains 五嶽|五岳[Wu3 yue4]
lofty/Mt Song in Henan
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Songshan is one of the first-inhabited area of Chinese ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 嵩山是中国祖先最早居住的地区之一。

sentences.english: Jiao's masterpieces mainly are Chinese landscape paintings, especially are ones about Songshan Mountain.
sentences.chinese: 作品以中国山水画为主，尤以画嵩山见长。

sentences.english: I am down by Zhongshan Road and Songshan Road but I will go back up by Jinsha road.
sentences.chinese: 我中山北路和嵩山路，但我会去金沙江路备份。

sentences.english: Climbing Peak Junji was a must for ancient people who traveled to Mt. Taishi of Mt. Songshan.
sentences.chinese: 古人游访嵩山太室，莫不以登峻极峰为美谈。

sentences.english: The moon is the finest sliver of pale gold in the blackness lying over the Songshan mountains.
sentences.chinese: 淡金色的月牙挂在黑沉沉的嵩山上。

sentences.english: In the songshan pie left cold zen do not believe that so many people have to do it well.
sentences.chinese: 嵩山派内左冷禅不相信这么多人都没有把事情办好。

sentences.english: “Dengfeng city has the oldest mountain in China, Mount Song, ” Mr. Mei said.
sentences.chinese: “登封市有中国最古老的山，嵩山”，梅先生说。

definition: Mt Heng in Shanxi, northern mountain of the Five Sacred Mountains 五嶽|五岳[Wu3 yue4]/Hengshan district of Jixi city 雞西|鸡西[Ji1 xi1], Heilongjiang
Mt Hua in Shaanxi, western mountain of the Five Sacred Mountains 五嶽|五岳[Wu3 yue4]
Wudang Mountain range in northwest Hubei
Mt Mang at Luoyang in Henan, with many Han, Wei and Jin dynasty royal tombs
Zhongnan mountains, near Xi'an
Zhongnan Mountains, near Xi'an/also known as the Taiyi Mountains

Five Sacred Mountains of the Daoists, namely: Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong, Mt Hua 華山|华山[Hua4 Shan1] in Shaanxi, Mt Heng 衡山[Heng2 Shan1] in Hunan, Mt Heng 恆山|恒山[Heng2 Shan1] in Shanxi, Mt Song 嵩山[Song1 Shan1] in Henan
Kongtong district of Pingliang city 平涼市|平凉市[Ping2 liang2 shi4], Gansu
Funiu mountain range in southwest Henan, an eastern extension of Qinling range 秦嶺山脈|秦岭山脉[Qin2 ling3 shan1 mai4], Shaanxi
Mt Heng in Hunan, southern mountain of the Five Sacred Mountains 五嶽|五岳[Wu3 yue4]/Hengshan county in Hengyang 衡陽|衡阳[Heng2 yang2], Hunan
Shaolin Temple, Buddhist monastery famous for its kung fu monks
Mt Song 嵩山 in Henan, one of the Five Sacred Mountains 五嶽|五岳[Wu3 yue4]
the Shaolin monastery and martial arts school
Mt Emei in Sichuan, one of the Four Sacred Mountains and Bodhimanda of Samantabhadra 普賢|普贤
Mt Jiuhua in Anhui, one of the Four Sacred Mountains and Bodhimanda of Kṣitigarbha 地藏
Shushan district of Hefei city 合肥市[He2 fei2 shi4], Anhui
